pageTitle: EPA-EDC Papers | Bibliometrics | Publications & Proceedings | NCER | Research | US EPA
textBeforeTable: The papers reviewed covered the following ESI fields: ESI and Highly Cited Publications The analysis was completed using the Thomson Essential Science Indicators (ESI) and Journal Citation Report (JCR) as benchmarks. The following is a summary of the EPA-EDC papers compared to ESI and JCR. The remaining citations will be double checked for inclusion in the final report. 10 records with a status of “In press” or “In review”. No published citation found 21 records where there was no article for the author, journal, or title listed by EPA 4 journals not indexed by Thomson 20 book records. Thomson indexes primarily journals. 12 duplicates 67 records omitted for the following conditions: 283 successful citation results This is a bibliometric analysis of a collection of 388 EPA-EDC papers. For this report, 283 papers were reviewed. The data breakdown from the 388 citations provided by EPA is as follows: EPA REPORT - DRAFT January 5, 2006 Extramural Research Search Grantee Research Project Results --> Meetings, Workshops, & Progress Reviews Archives Bibliometrics EPA-EDC Papers Bibliometrics Publications &
textAfterTable: Of these, EPA appeared in the top 1% in 4 fields. The following table show the number of EPA papers in those 4 fields that met the top 1% threshold in ESI.
